Class AudioRecordings

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • AudioRecordings
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class AudioRecordings
extends java.lang.Thread
    Version Information:

    Author Esther Yoo Version # 1 Date 06.01.16 Time Spent 2 hours

    Version:
    1 06.05.16 The AudioRecordings class loads all the audio recordings we will use for our game and puts them in static arrays, making them easily accessible.

    Instance variables:

    background A static Clip array that stores references to all the background music.

    alphabet A static Clip array that stores references to all the the clips that go "Click the letter [...]!".

    alphabetB A static Clip array that stores references to all the the clips that go "Click the letter that comes before [...]!".

    alphabetA A static Clip array that stores references to all the the clips that go "Click the letter that comes after [...]!".

    effects A static Clip array that stores all the sound effects (ex. bubble popping) used in the game.

    Author:
    Esther Yoo

    • Constructor Detail

      • AudioRecordings

        public AudioRecordings()

    • Method Detail

      • loadAudio

        public void loadAudio()
        This method loads all rhe audio into their appropriate arrays. Firstly, the entire method is inside a try-catch statement (opening Clips may throw lots of errors!). Next, the audio clips are read in one by one using for-loops. The first for-loop loads the background music files/ The second for-loop loads the regular "Click the letter [...]" files. The third for-loop loads the audio clips that begin "Click the letter that comes before [...]". The fourth for-loop loads the audio clips that begin "Click the letter that comes after [...]". The fifth for-loop loads the effects.

      • volume

        public static void volume(float volAdjust,
                          javax.sound.sampled.Clip clip)
        This method changes the volume of a given clip.
        Parameters:
        volAdjust - float that stores the amount to adjust the volume by
        clip - int that stores the index of the clip to have its volume altered

      • playLevelsOneTwo

        public static void playLevelsOneTwo(int stop,
                                    int play)
        This static method stops the specified alphabet clip, then sets MicrosecondPosition to 0 and plays the audio of the next specified alphabet clip.
        Parameters:
        stop - int that stores the index of alphabet clip it is supposed to stop.
        play - int that stores the index of alphabet clip it is supposed to play.

      • playLevelThree

        public static void playLevelThree(int rand,
                                  int stop,
                                  int play)
        This static method stops the specified alphabet clip, then sets MicrosecondPosition to 0 and plays the audio of the next specified alphabet clip, which is decided depending on the value of the passed in rand variable.
        Parameters:
        rand - int that stores whether the clip being played is "Click the letter that comes before [...]" or "Click the letter that comes after [...]".
        stop - int that stores the index of alphabetB/alphabetA clip it is supposed to stop.
        play - int that stores the index of alphabetB/alphabetA clip it is supposed to play.
